info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 24 at 3:57PM CDT until May 24 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL CROCKETT COUNTY... At 356 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles southwest of Ozona, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Ozona around 420 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Us- 190 Near The Crockett-Sutton County Line and I-10 Near The Crockett- Sutton County Line. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 352 and 379. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
